alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Kershaw; Lexington; Newberry; Richland; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 7:55AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following counties, Fairfield, Kershaw, Lexington, Newberry, Richland and Sumter. * WHEN...Until 945 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 755 AM EDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia, Irmo, Forest Acres, Camden, Winnsboro, Dentsville, St. Andrews, Lake Wateree Dam, VC Summer Nuclear Station, Elgin, Arcadia Lakes, Killian, Lake Carolina, Villages at Sandhill, Sesquicentennial State Park, Woodfield, Columbia International University, Fairfield County Airport and Harbison State Forest. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 69 and 99. Interstate 77 between mile markers 16 and 37. Interstate 26 between mile markers 82 and 103. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Fairfield; Kershaw; Lexington; Newberry; Richland; Sumter
